member.name: T:RestSharp.NtlmAuthenticator
member.summary: Tries to Authenticate with the credentials of the currently logged in user, or impersonate a user

member.name: M:RestSharp.NtlmAuthenticator.#ctor
member.summary: Authenticate with the credentials of the currently logged in user

member.name: M:RestSharp.NtlmAuthenticator.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Authenticate by impersonation

member.name: M:RestSharp.NtlmAuthenticator.#ctor(System.Net.ICredentials)
member.summary: Authenticate by impersonation, using an existing ICredentials instance

member.name: T:RestSharp.OAuth2Authenticator
member.summary: Base class for OAuth 2 Authenticators.
member.remarks:
Since there are many ways to authenticate in OAuth2, this is used as a base class to differentiate between other authenticators.
Any other OAuth2 authenticators must derive from this abstract class.

member.name: F:RestSharp.OAuth2Authenticator._accessToken
member.summary: Access token to be used when authenticating.

member.name: M:RestSharp.OAuth2Authenticator.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:RestSharp.OAuth2Authenticator.AccessToken
member.summary: Gets the access token.

member.name: T:RestSharp.OAuth2UriQueryParameterAuthenticator
member.summary: The OAuth 2 authenticator using URI query parameter.

member.name: M:RestSharp.OAuth2UriQueryParameterAuthenticator.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: T:RestSharp.OAuth2AuthorizationRequestHeaderAuthenticator
member.summary: The OAuth 2 authenticator using the authorization request header field.

member.name: F:RestSharp.OAuth2AuthorizationRequestHeaderAuthenticator._authorizationValue
member.summary: Stores the Authorization header value as "[tokenType] accessToken". used for performance.

member.name: M:RestSharp.OAuth2AuthorizationRequestHeaderAuthenticator.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:RestSharp.OAuth2AuthorizationRequestHeaderAuthenticator.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: F:RestSharp.Authenticators.OAuth.OAuthTools._encoding
member.summary: All text parameters are UTF-8 encoded (per section 5.1).

member.name: M:RestSharp.Authenticators.OAuth.OAuthTools.GetNonce
member.summary: Generates a random 16-byte lowercase alphanumeric string.

member.name: M:RestSharp.Authenticators.OAuth.OAuthTools.GetTimestamp
member.summary: Generates a timestamp based on the current elapsed seconds since '01/01/1970 0000 GMT"

member.name: M:RestSharp.Authenticators.OAuth.OAuthTools.GetTimestamp(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Generates a timestamp based on the elapsed seconds of a given time since '01/01/1970 0000 GMT"

member.name: F:RestSharp.Authenticators.OAuth.OAuthTools.UriRfc3986CharsToEscape
member.summary: The set of characters that are unreserved in RFC 2396 but are NOT unreserved in RFC 3986.

member.name: M:RestSharp.Authenticators.OAuth.OAuthTools.UrlEncodeRelaxed(System.String)
member.summary: URL encodes a string based on section 5.1 of the OAuth spec. Namely, percent encoding with [RFC3986], avoiding unreserved characters, upper-casing hexadecimal characters, and UTF-8 encoding for text value pairs.
member.remarks: The method is supposed to take on RFC 3986 behavior if certain elements are present in a .config file. Even if this actually worked (which in my experiments it doesn't), we can't rely on every host actually having this configuration element present.

member.name: M:RestSharp.Authenticators.OAuth.OAuthTools.UrlEncodeStrict(System.String)
member.summary: URL encodes a string based on section 5.1 of the OAuth spec. Namely, percent encoding with [RFC3986], avoiding unreserved characters, upper-casing hexadecimal characters, and UTF-8 encoding for text value pairs.

member.name: M:RestSharp.Authenticators.OAuth.OAuthTools.NormalizeRequestParameters(RestSharp.Authenticators.OAuth.WebParameterCollection)
member.summary: Sorts a collection of key-value pairs by name, and then value if equal, concatenating them into a single string. This string should be encoded prior to, or after normalization is run.

member.name: M:RestSharp.Authenticators.OAuth.OAuthTools.SortParametersExcludingSignature(RestSharp.Authenticators.OAuth.WebParameterCollection)
member.summary: Sorts a by name, and then value if equal.
member.param: A collection of parameters to sort

member.name: M:RestSharp.Authenticators.OAuth.OAuthTools.ConstructRequestUrl(System.Uri)
member.summary: Creates a request URL suitable for making OAuth requests. Resulting URLs must exclude port 80 or port 443 when accompanied by HTTP and HTTPS, respectively. Resulting URLs must be lower case.

member.name: M:RestSharp.Authenticators.OAuth.OAuthTools.ConcatenateRequestElements(System.String,System.String,RestSharp.Authenticators.OAuth.WebParameterCollection)
member.summary: Creates a request elements concatentation value to send with a request. This is also known as the signature base.

member.name: M:RestSharp.Authenticators.OAuth.OAuthTools.GetSignature(RestSharp.Authenticators.OAuth.OAuthSignatureMethod,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a signature value given a signature base and the consumer secret. This method is used when the token secret is currently unknown.

member.name: M:RestSharp.Authenticators.OAuth.OAuthTools.GetSignature(RestSharp.Authenticators.OAuth.OAuthSignatureMethod,RestSharp.Authenticators.OAuth.OAuthSignatureTreatment,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a signature value given a signature base and the consumer secret. This method is used when the token secret is currently unknown.
member.param: The treatment to use on a signature value

member.name: M:RestSharp.Authenticators.OAuth.OAuthTools.GetSignature(RestSharp.Authenticators.OAuth.OAuthSignatureMethod,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a signature value given a signature base and the consumer secret and a known token secret.

member.name: M:RestSharp.Authenticators.OAuth.OAuthTools.GetSignature(RestSharp.Authenticators.OAuth.OAuthSignatureMethod,RestSharp.Authenticators.OAuth.OAuthSignatureTreatment,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a signature value given a signature base and the consumer secret and a known token secret.
member.param: The treatment to use on a signature value

member.summary: A class to encapsulate OAuth authentication flow.

member.summary: Generates a instance to pass to an for the purpose of requesting an unauthorized request token.
member.param: The HTTP method for the intended request

member.summary: Generates a instance to pass to an for the purpose of requesting an unauthorized request token.
member.param: The HTTP method for the intended request
Any existing, non-OAuth query parameters desired in the request

member.name: M:RestSharp.Authenticators.OAuth.OAuthWorkflow.BuildAccessTokenInfo(System.String)
member.summary: Generates a instance to pass to an for the purpose of exchanging a request token for an access token authorized by the user at the Service Provider site.
member.param: The HTTP method for the intended request

member.name: M:RestSharp.Authenticators.OAuth.OAuthWorkflow.BuildAccessTokenInfo(System.String,RestSharp.Authenticators.OAuth.WebParameterCollection)
member.summary: Generates a instance to pass to an for the purpose of exchanging a request token for an access token authorized by the user at the Service Provider site.
member.param: The HTTP method for the intended request
Any existing, non-OAuth query parameters desired in the request

member.name: M:RestSharp.Authenticators.OAuth.OAuthWorkflow.BuildClientAuthAccessTokenInfo(System.String,RestSharp.Authenticators.OAuth.WebParameterCollection)
member.summary: Generates a instance to pass to an for the purpose of exchanging user credentials for an access token authorized by the user at the Service Provider site.
member.param: The HTTP method for the intended request
Any existing, non-OAuth query parameters desired in the request

member.name: M:RestSharp.RestClientExtensions.AddDefaultParameter(RestSharp.IRestClient,RestSharp.Parameter)
member.summary: Add a parameter to use on every request made with this client instance

member.name: M:RestSharp.RestClientExtensions.RemoveDefaultParameter(RestSharp.IRestClient,System.String)
member.summary: Removes a parameter from the default parameters that are used on every request made with this client instance
member.param: The name of the parameter that needs to be removed

member.name: M:RestSharp.RestClientExtensions.AddDefaultParameter(RestSharp.IRestClient,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Adds a HTTP parameter (QueryString for GET, DELETE, OPTIONS and HEAD; Encoded form for POST and PUT) Used on every request made by this client instance

member.name: M:RestSharp.RestClientExtensions.AddDefaultParameter(RestSharp.IRestClient,System.String,System.Object,RestSharp.ParameterType)
member.summary: Adds a parameter to the request. There are four types of parameters: - GetOrPost: Either a QueryString value or encoded form value based on method - HttpHeader: Adds the name/value pair to the HTTP request's Headers collection - UrlSegment: Inserted into URL if there is a matching url token e.g. {AccountId} - RequestBody: Used by AddBody() (not recommended to use directly)
member.param: The type of parameter to add

member.name: M:RestSharp.RestClientExtensions.AddDefaultHeader(RestSharp.IRestClient,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Shortcut to AddDefaultParameter(name, value, HttpHeader) overload
member.param: Name of the header to add
Value of the header to add

member.name: M:RestSharp.RestClientExtensions.AddDefaultUrlSegment(RestSharp.IRestClient,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Shortcut to AddDefaultParameter(name, value, UrlSegment) overload
member.param: Name of the segment to add
Value of the segment to add

member.name: P:RestSharp.IRestClient.ClientCertificates
member.summary: X509CertificateCollection to be sent with request

member.name: M:RestSharp.IRestRequest.AddFile(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Adds a file to the Files collection to be included with a POST or PUT request (other methods do not support file uploads).
member.param: The parameter name to use in the request
Full path to file to upload
The MIME type of the file to upload

member.name: M:RestSharp.IRestRequest.AddFile(System.String,System.Byte[],System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Adds the bytes to the Files collection with the specified file name and content type
member.param: The parameter name to use in the request
The file name to use for the uploaded file
The MIME type of the file to upload

member.name: M:RestSharp.IRestRequest.AddFile(System.String,System.Action{System.IO.Stream},System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Adds the bytes to the Files collection with the specified file name and content type
member.param: The parameter name to use in the request
A function that writes directly to the stream. Should NOT close the stream.
The file name to use for the uploaded file
The MIME type of the file to upload

member.name: M:RestSharp.IRestRequest.AddBody(System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Serializes obj to format specified by RequestFormat, but passes xmlNamespace if using the default XmlSerializer The default format is XML. Change RequestFormat if you wish to use a different serialization format.
member.param: The XML namespace to use when serializing

member.name: M:RestSharp.IRestRequest.AddBody(System.Object)
member.summary: Serializes obj to data format specified by RequestFormat and adds it to the request body. The default format is XML. Change RequestFormat if you wish to use a different serialization format.

member.name: M:RestSharp.IRestRequest.AddJsonBody(System.Object)
member.summary: Serializes obj to JSON format and adds it to the request body.

member.name: M:RestSharp.IRestRequest.AddXmlBody(System.Object)
member.summary: Serializes obj to XML format and adds it to the request body.

member.name: M:RestSharp.IRestRequest.AddXmlBody(System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Serializes obj to format specified by RequestFormat, but passes xmlNamespace if using the default XmlSerializer Serializes obj to XML format and passes xmlNamespace then adds it to the request body.
member.param: The XML namespace to use when serializing

member.name: M:RestSharp.IRestRequest.AddObject(System.Object,System.String[])
member.summary: Calls AddParameter() for all public, readable properties specified in the includedProperties list
member.param: The object with properties to add as parameters
The names of the properties to include

member.name: M:RestSharp.IRestRequest.AddObject(System.Object)
member.summary: Calls AddParameter() for all public, readable properties of obj
member.param: The object with properties to add as parameters

member.name: M:RestSharp.IRestRequest.AddParameter(RestSharp.Parameter)
member.summary: Add the parameter to the request

member.name: M:RestSharp.IRestRequest.AddParameter(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Adds a HTTP parameter to the request (QueryString for GET, DELETE, OPTIONS and HEAD; Encoded form for POST and PUT)

member.name: M:RestSharp.IRestRequest.AddParameter(System.String,System.Object,RestSharp.ParameterType)
member.summary: Adds a parameter to the request. There are five types of parameters: - GetOrPost: Either a QueryString value or encoded form value based on method - HttpHeader: Adds the name/value pair to the HTTP request's Headers collection - UrlSegment: Inserted into URL if there is a matching url token e.g. {AccountId} - Cookie: Adds the name/value pair to the HTTP request's Cookies collection - RequestBody: Used by AddBody() (not recommended to use directly)
member.param: The type of parameter to add

member.name: M:RestSharp.IRestRequest.AddHeader(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Shortcut to AddParameter(name, value, HttpHeader) overload
member.param: Name of the header to add
Value of the header to add

member.name: M:RestSharp.IRestRequest.AddCookie(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Shortcut to AddParameter(name, value, Cookie) overload
member.param: Name of the cookie to add
Value of the cookie to add

member.name: M:RestSharp.IRestRequest.AddUrlSegment(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Shortcut to AddParameter(name, value, UrlSegment) overload
member.param: Name of the segment to add
Value of the segment to add

member.name: M:RestSharp.IRestRequest.AddQueryParameter(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Shortcut to AddParameter(name, value, QueryString) overload
member.param: Name of the parameter to add
Value of the parameter to add

member.name: P:RestSharp.IRestRequest.AlwaysMultipartFormData
member.summary: Always send a multipart/form-data request - even when no Files are present.

member.name: P:RestSharp.IRestRequest.JsonSerializer
member.summary: Serializer to use when writing JSON request bodies. Used if RequestFormat is Json. By default the included JsonSerializer is used (currently using JSON.NET default serialization).

member.name: P:RestSharp.IRestRequest.XmlSerializer
member.summary: Serializer to use when writing XML request bodies. Used if RequestFormat is Xml. By default the included XmlSerializer is used.

member.name: P:RestSharp.IRestRequest.ResponseWriter
member.summary: Set this to write response to Stream rather than reading into memory.

member.name: P:RestSharp.IRestRequest.Parameters
member.summary: Container of all HTTP parameters to be passed with the request. See AddParameter() for explanation of the types of parameters that can be passed

member.name: P:RestSharp.IRestRequest.Files
member.summary: Container of all the files to be uploaded with the request.

member.name: P:RestSharp.IRestRequest.Method
member.summary: Determines what HTTP method to use for this request. Supported methods: GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, HEAD, OPTIONS Default is GET

member.name: P:RestSharp.IRestRequest.Resource
member.summary: The Resource URL to make the request against. Tokens are substituted with UrlSegment parameters and match by name. Should not include the scheme or domain. Do not include leading slash. Combined with RestClient.BaseUrl to assemble final URL: {BaseUrl}/{Resource} (BaseUrl is scheme + domain, e.g. http://example.com)

member.name: P:RestSharp.IRestRequest.RequestFormat
member.summary: Serializer to use when writing XML request bodies. Used if RequestFormat is Xml. By default XmlSerializer is used.

member.name: P:RestSharp.IRestRequest.RootElement
member.summary: Used by the default deserializers to determine where to start deserializing from. Can be used to skip container or root elements that do not have corresponding deserialzation targets.

member.name: P:RestSharp.IRestRequest.DateFormat
member.summary: Used by the default deserializers to explicitly set which date format string to use when parsing dates.

member.name: P:RestSharp.IRestRequest.XmlNamespace
member.summary: Used by XmlDeserializer. If not specified, XmlDeserializer will flatten response by removing namespaces from element names.

member.name: P:RestSharp.IRestRequest.Credentials
member.summary: In general you would not need to set this directly. Used by the NtlmAuthenticator.

member.name: P:RestSharp.IRestRequest.Timeout
member.summary: Timeout in milliseconds to be used for the request. This timeout value overrides a timeout set on the RestClient.

member.name: P:RestSharp.IRestRequest.ReadWriteTimeout
member.summary: The number of milliseconds before the writing or reading times out. This timeout value overrides a timeout set on the RestClient.

member.name: P:RestSharp.IRestRequest.Attempts
member.summary: How many attempts were made to send this Request?
member.remarks: This Number is incremented each time the RestClient sends the request. Useful when using Asynchronous Execution with Callbacks

member.name: P:RestSharp.IRestRequest.UseDefaultCredentials
member.summary: Determine whether or not the "default credentials" (e.g. the user account under which the current process is running) will be sent along to the server. The default is false.

member.name: T:RestSharp.IRestResponse
member.summary: Container for data sent back from API

member.name: P:RestSharp.IRestResponse.Request
member.summary: The RestRequest that was made to get this RestResponse
member.remarks: Mainly for debugging if ResponseStatus is not OK

member.name: P:RestSharp.IRestResponse.ContentType
member.summary: MIME content type of response

member.name: P:RestSharp.IRestResponse.ContentLength
member.summary: Length in bytes of the response content

member.name: P:RestSharp.IRestResponse.ContentEncoding
member.summary: Encoding of the response content

member.name: P:RestSharp.IRestResponse.Content
member.summary: String representation of response content

member.name: P:RestSharp.IRestResponse.StatusCode
member.summary: HTTP response status code

member.name: P:RestSharp.IRestResponse.StatusDescription
member.summary: Description of HTTP status returned

member.name: P:RestSharp.IRestResponse.RawBytes
member.summary: Response content

member.name: P:RestSharp.IRestResponse.ResponseUri
member.summary: The URL that actually responded to the content (different from request if redirected)

member.name: P:RestSharp.IRestResponse.Server
member.summary: HttpWebResponse.Server

member.name: P:RestSharp.IRestResponse.Cookies
member.summary: Cookies returned by server with the response

member.name: P:RestSharp.IRestResponse.Headers
member.summary: Headers returned by server with the response

member.name: P:RestSharp.IRestResponse.ResponseStatus
member.summary: Status of the request. Will return Error for transport errors. HTTP errors will still return ResponseStatus.Completed, check StatusCode instead

member.name: P:RestSharp.IRestResponse.ErrorMessage
member.summary: Transport or other non-HTTP error generated while attempting request

member.name: P:RestSharp.IRestResponse.ErrorException
member.summary: Exceptions thrown during the request, if any.
member.remarks: Will contain only network transport or framework exceptions thrown during the request. HTTP protocol errors are handled by RestSharp and will not appear here.

member.name: T:RestSharp.IRestResponse`1
member.summary: Container for data sent back from API including deserialized data
member.typeparam: Type of data to deserialize to

member.name: P:RestSharp.IRestResponse`1.Data
member.summary: Deserialized entity data

member.summary: X509CertificateCollection to be sent with request

member.summary: Proxy to use for requests made by this client instance. Passed on to underlying WebRequest if set.

member.name: P:RestSharp.RestClient.FollowRedirects
member.summary: Default is true. Determine whether or not requests that result in HTTP status codes of 3xx should follow returned redirect

member.name: P:RestSharp.RestClient.CookieContainer

member.summary: The number of milliseconds before the writing or reading times out.

member.summary: Whether to invoke async callbacks using the SynchronizationContext.Current captured when invoked

member.name: P:RestSharp.RestClient.Authenticator
member.summary: Authenticator to use for requests made by this client instance

member.name: P:RestSharp.RestClient.BaseUrl
member.summary: Combined with Request.Resource to construct URL for request Should include scheme and domain without trailing slash.

member.name: P:RestSharp.RestClient.DefaultParameters
member.summary: Parameters included with every request made with this instance of RestClient If specified in both client and request, the request wins

member.name: M:RestSharp.RestRequest.IncreaseNumAttempts
member.summary: Internal Method so that RestClient can increase the number of attempts

member.name: P:RestSharp.RestRequest.AlwaysMultipartFormData
member.summary: Always send a multipart/form-data request - even when no Files are present.

member.name: P:RestSharp.RestRequest.JsonSerializer
member.summary: Serializer to use when writing JSON request bodies. Used if RequestFormat is Json. By default the included JsonSerializer is used (currently using JSON.NET default serialization).

member.name: P:RestSharp.RestRequest.XmlSerializer
member.summary: Serializer to use when writing XML request bodies. Used if RequestFormat is Xml. By default the included XmlSerializer is used.

member.name: P:RestSharp.RestRequest.ResponseWriter
member.summary: Set this to write response to Stream rather than reading into memory.

member.name: P:RestSharp.RestRequest.UseDefaultCredentials
member.summary: Determine whether or not the "default credentials" (e.g. the user account under which the current process is running) will be sent along to the server. The default is false.

member.name: P:RestSharp.RestRequest.Parameters
member.summary: Container of all HTTP parameters to be passed with the request. See AddParameter() for explanation of the types of parameters that can be passed

member.name: P:RestSharp.RestRequest.Files
member.summary: Container of all the files to be uploaded with the request.

member.name: P:RestSharp.RestRequest.Method
member.summary: Determines what HTTP method to use for this request. Supported methods: GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, HEAD, OPTIONS Default is GET

member.name: P:RestSharp.RestRequest.Resource
member.summary: The Resource URL to make the request against. Tokens are substituted with UrlSegment parameters and match by name. Should not include the scheme or domain. Do not include leading slash. Combined with RestClient.BaseUrl to assemble final URL: {BaseUrl}/{Resource} (BaseUrl is scheme + domain, e.g. http://example.com)

member.name: P:RestSharp.RestRequest.RequestFormat
member.summary: Serializer to use when writing XML request bodies. Used if RequestFormat is Xml. By default XmlSerializer is used.

member.name: P:RestSharp.RestRequest.RootElement
member.summary: Used by the default deserializers to determine where to start deserializing from. Can be used to skip container or root elements that do not have corresponding deserialzation targets.

member.name: P:RestSharp.RestRequest.OnBeforeDeserialization
member.summary: A function to run prior to deserializing starting (e.g. change settings if error encountered)

member.name: P:RestSharp.RestRequest.DateFormat
member.summary: Used by the default deserializers to explicitly set which date format string to use when parsing dates.

member.name: P:RestSharp.RestRequest.XmlNamespace
member.summary: Used by XmlDeserializer. If not specified, XmlDeserializer will flatten response by removing namespaces from element names.

member.name: P:RestSharp.RestRequest.Credentials
member.summary: In general you would not need to set this directly. Used by the NtlmAuthenticator.

member.name: P:RestSharp.RestRequest.UserState
member.summary: Gets or sets a user-defined state object that contains information about a request and which can be later retrieved when the request completes.

member.name: P:RestSharp.RestRequest.Timeout
member.summary: Timeout in milliseconds to be used for the request. This timeout value overrides a timeout set on the RestClient.

member.name: P:RestSharp.RestRequest.ReadWriteTimeout
member.summary: The number of milliseconds before the writing or reading times out. This timeout value overrides a timeout set on the RestClient.

member.name: P:RestSharp.RestRequest.Attempts
member.summary: How many attempts were made to send this Request?
member.remarks: This Number is incremented each time the RestClient sends the request. Useful when using Asynchronous Execution with Callbacks

member.name: P:RestSharp.RestResponseCookie.CommentUri

member.name: T:RestSharp.SimpleJson
member.summary:
This class encodes and decodes JSON strings. Spec. details, see http://www.json.org/
JSON uses Arrays and Objects. These correspond here to the datatypes JsonArray(IList<object>) and JsonObject(IDictionary<string,object>). All numbers are parsed to doubles.

member.name: M:RestSharp.SimpleJson.DeserializeObject(System.String)
member.summary: Parses the string json into a value
member.returns: An IList<object>, a IDictionary<string,object>, a double, a string, null, true, or false

member.name: M:RestSharp.SimpleJson.TryDeserializeObject(System.String,System.Object@)
member.summary: Try parsing the json string into a value.
member.returns: Returns true if successfull otherwise false.

member.name: M:RestSharp.SimpleJson.SerializeObject(System.Object,RestSharp.IJsonSerializerStrategy)
member.summary: Converts a IDictionary<string,object> / IList<object> object into a JSON string
member.returns: A JSON encoded string, or null if object 'json' is not serializable

member.name: M:RestSharp.SimpleJson.IsNumeric(System.Object)
member.summary: Determines if a given object is numeric in any way (can be integer, double, null, etc).
